title: Rachel Griffiths: 'Why I turned down the highest-paying role of her career'
text:
Rachel Griffiths has revealed the most lucrative offer she turned down during her acting career.

The Muriel's Wedding star, 50, said she had the opportunity to play a forensic scientist in a top American crime drama.

But despite being offered a 'shedload of money', Rachel decided it was 'too dark'.

'It was a shedload of money!' Rachel Griffiths has revealed why she turned down the highest-paying role of her career

Speaking to Hit105's Stav, Abby and Matt on Wednesday, Rachel discussed the roles she won't touch.

She said: 'The biggest turn-down I had for the most money was one of those shows with a woman on a slab.

'I just can't do that for five years, stand in front of a body at the start of my week. It was a shedload of money and I just thought, "No, I won't make it".'

Don't go there! The Muriel's Wedding star, 50, said she had the opportunity to play a forensic scientist in a top American crime drama but felt the role was 'too dark'

The AACTA Award winner added that it wasn't the first time she had turned down a major part.

She also 'passed on' a role in the blockbuster hit Men in Black, presumably as the female lead, Dr Laurel Weaver.

But despite making it to the final stages of auditions, Rachel said she couldn't get her head around the film's sci-fi humour.

What could've been! Rachel also 'passed on' a role in Men in Black, presumably as the female lead, Dr Laurel Weaver. Pictured: Tommy Lee Jones (left) and Will Smith (right) in Men in Black

'I was apparently shortlisted for Men in Black but I just don't get it,' she said. 'Apparently [the film] was huge!'

Last year, Rachel directed Ride Like a Girl, a biopic about jockey Michelle Payne, who became the first woman to win the Melbourne Cup 2015.

Married to artist Andrew Taylor, Rachel is perhaps most known for her roles in Hacksaw Ridge and Muriel's Wedding.
